results.title: Three cows
results.creator_credit: Gavin Bannerman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gavin Bannerman grew up on a farm out of Brisbane. The Bannermans had a deal with the local butcher for their cattle and every season they would either have a fridge full of meat or a tidy sum. One day, they decided to name their cows.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gavin Bannerman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Gavin Bannerman grew up on a farm out of Brisbane. The Bannermans had a deal with the local butcher for their cattle and every season they would either have a fridge full of meat or a tidy sum. One day, they decided to name their cows.
description_for_label: Gavin Bannerman grew up on a farm out of Brisbane. The Bannermans had a deal with the local butcher for their cattle and every season they would either have a fridge full of meat or a tidy sum. One day, they decided to name their cows.

results.title: Scooter girl
results.creator_credit: Melissa McLachlan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Melissa McLachlan considers the advantages of having a scooter to get to work and the social benefits. The scooter is much more than a mode of transport for McLachlan.

results.title: Remembering
results.creator_credit: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Laura Brearley’s dear friend died of cancer, Brearley took solace in her art, her music and remembering. In doing this, Brearley gave the gift of comfort to many others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Laura Brearley’s dear friend died of cancer, Brearley took solace in her art, her music and remembering. In doing this, Brearley gave the gift of comfort to many others.

results.title: Rangipukea
results.creator_credit: Vanessa James, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vanessa James talks about the island just off the end of the farm that her family used to own. There they would farm sheep and cattle over the years and throughout the generations.

results.title: In recognition
results.creator_credit: Gerald Ashcroft, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Capturing the light and being in the moment, what more could you ask for?’ Gerald Ashcroft’s mother talked him out of giving up piano with a garden hoe. Many years on, he is grateful for that, as he is for his two beautiful daughters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Ashcroft, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Honore et labore
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Diffey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Rhonda Diffey attended her high school reunion, she met two ex-students Frank Spik and Win Ellis both from classes of 1916 and 1915 respectively. Their stories have instilled in Diffey a glimpse into the past and a sense of pride in her school.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhonda Diffey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Gift
results.creator_credit: Jodine Stodart, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 2005, Jodine Stodart travelled to Oxfam Australia to India. It was there that she met a unique lady, not much older than herself, that would leave a lasting impression on the young traveller.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jodine Stodart, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Triple jump
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”
The technique of the triple jump, sometimes known as the hop, step and jump, is shown in normal and slow motion speeds. Training and preparation techniques for achieving success in this event from the beginner stage are also shown.
